text: Fantastic fish and chips! When I lived in BC the local White Spot was a regular haunt. It was a well-regarded local chain of family restaurants. Nostalgia drew me here but this place was much better than the White Spot restaurants I knew back on the coast. The servers were great, patient and friendly. The room is mainly booths, with soft lighting and warm colours and it feels like a nice place to be. For me, that alone makes it worth the drive to visit this place. The meal is what makes me look forward to making this trip again though. Back on the coast, my standard White Spot choice was fish & chips. That was what I had when I visited here but the food here was so much better than I remembered! They used fresh halibut and home made chips, even a scratch-made tartar sauce. Absolutely great! I usually try to avoid chain restaurants but this place is a definite exception. Everything was done with care and attentions and the service was excellent. Next time I get a craving for great fish &chips; this is where you’ll find me.

text:
Following excellent customer service follow-up from management to ensure we are happy customers, providing us with overwhelming details not only once but twice including contact from their area manager we are changing our review to reflect our satisfaction.
 
 We shall both revisit this restaurant in the future .
 
 ______________________________
 
 My partner Ange works from home in a high powered role. Her company had a virtual luncheon and I had pre-ordered her lunch through skip the dishes. The options are out there of who to chose for your dining.
 I specifically selected White spot as they are particularly close to our home.
 
 Very disappointingly the food was delivered by skip the dishes!! Upon delivery they did not ring out camera doorbell thus the food stayed outside awaiting collection. Ange was on a video zoom call and was unaware the food had already been delivered due to putting her phone on silent during the zoom call
 
 It was our first time ordering from this company and it will be our last!
 
 Having called the manager to let him know about the service an attempt was made by the manager Rob to resolve the situation by offering a voucher. He confirmed he would come to the house to personally deliver this which was sincerely appreciated at the time. Rob had confirmed he was going to come by at around 5:00 by 7:30 p.m. he was a no-show. Again calling White Spot we were told that he did not leave white spot.
 
 It is so disappointing during the time of this pandemic, Covid19, you would think all restaurants are happy to have customers to provide them with business that they would put a priority on this to ensure they have a return on business; sadly to say this was not the issue yesterday.
 
 Disappointing service .... Would not recommend.

text: I recently had dinner at White Spot. The restaurant is very nice. The food was very nice as well. The menu has plenty of options. Lots of parking. Convenient location as my hotel was next door. name: Michelle Schneider
text: DEVON was incredible. He single handedly upgraded our date night to an experience we'll never forget. When we weren't sure which beer to choose, he brought us samples of the 2 we were choosing from. But he brought 3 samples over, suggesting we try one of his personal favourites as well - and that was the one we picked! He was just able to read us really well. He helped accommodate our dietary restrictons and was very attentive. Great conversation and wonderful experience because of him. Thank you White Spot for employing such an outstanding employee to your team!

name: Jim Turner
text: Not sure where the negative reviews come from. I had a perfectly fine experience. The service was quick, attentive, and courteous. I ordered a bacon cheddar burger with fries which tasted fine. While perhaps not the very greatest burger I've ever had, it was still delicious, and I finished every last bite. The best part however was the music. It's like they had my Classic Rock playlist straight out of Spotify. Pink Floyd was playing when I arrived. That was followed by AC/DC, Journey, Credence Clearwater Revival, Neil Young, and a raft of other great artists. The menu has enough variety for me to return tomorrow evening to see what's playing then.

name: Michael Stewart
text:
This White Spot is incredible (as far as white spots go). I feel it is important to include this caveat. While many people who have reviewed this establishment have nothing but cruel things to say, what are they expecting? A $100 meal for White Spot prices?
 
 I had the vegetarian curry bowl which was incredible. I took a couple Brits with me, and they loved the fish and chips.
 
 Also, the Nat Bailey Pale Ale by Granville Island is on point.

name: Don Walden
text:
When I left my hotel room shortly after checking in, my stomach was yearning for a great meal. Hell, I would've eaten McDonalds and been satisfied.
 My Father and I were seated immediately - the place was empty - and we ordered a few beers. If they hadn't been as warm as the urine I excreted just moments before I sat down to write this review, they would have been the best part of our White Spot experience. I ordered a burger with no tomato, and my old man ordered a steak. The food arrived about fifteen minutes after we had spent twenty minutes forcing down our warm beer.
 I thanked the waitress - who looked as though she would rather be anywhere but at the good ol' White Spot - and took a chomp out of my cold and dripping burger. I relive the frozen patty terror every time I close my eyes. I peeled the three slices of soupy tomato off of the burger, and I forced down two more bites before I threw my white flag in the air and accepted defeat. My fathers meal was actually much worse, and he suffered defeat as well. When our cranky spanky waitress adorned us with her presence once more, she took the barely eaten food away and pretended that "all was well." They must be used to serving utter crap and pretending that their patrons are as crazy as their chef must be. I am definitely not a food snob but you couldn't eat this glorified sewage. If I had wanted to waste $80.00, I would've had better luck at the Palace Casino.
 Don't eat here.

name: Rebecca David
text: This is the second time this has happened at the same location. We waited more than an hour for a table for four adults and one toddler for over an hour on a Sunday. (We were told it would be a 20 minute wait. Each time we inquired, it would be "just a few more minutes") We were finally shown a table in the corner at the back, and then waited another 15 minutes for a waitress to take our drink orders. (We had to flag her down) She then told us she was never informed that she had customers at that table. The food is mediocre. The hostess is disorganized and overwhelmed when they are busy. The manager wasn't smiling or apologizing, but was instead very obviously frustrated as he slammed a bunch of menus on the hostess table and walked away without making eye contact with any customers. Will never be going back.
